item.description:
We always seem to have fun biking as a group. 

This ride is about 30 miles and runs through the nice towns of Lexington, Concord and Lincoln.

Not sure how long the ride will take us but we will try to keep roughly a 12 to 15 mile pace.  Will stop on occasion to make sure we try to travel as a group and will plan for a casual lunch in Concord along the way.

Lexington Center has a public parking lot and plenty of free parking on side streets.  Not sure if there is a parking charge on Sunday but I believe the normal cost is about $5 per day.

Things to bring:  Water, Sun Tan lotion, Money for lunch.

This is not a ride for the super competitive as we do stop for everyone.  With that said we expect people to be able to ride 30 miles and be in reasonably good shape and to have good enough judgement to know if this is or is not a ride for you.

No requirement for a road bike but probably not appropriate for a mountain bike.

Will reschedule if raining.

Here are the details on the ride

http://www321.pair.com/oaries/localattitude/lexington.htm
item.how_to_find_us: Will email my contact info the day before.
item.name: Lexington Loop 30 Mile Ride
